updated_cases.title: Verify whether Steering Configuration is shown as Bypass if the category which the URL belongs to is present in the Exception Configuration.
updated_cases.custom_summary: Verify whether Steering Configuration is shown as Bypass if the category which the URL belongs to is present in the Exception Configuration.
updated_cases.custom_steps:
1. Login to Tenant WebUI
 2. Click on Web, under Profiles in Policies tab
 3. Click on URL Lookup
 4. Under URL Lookup, enter any URL and hit Enter
updated_cases.custom_expected:
1. In URL List search result, Site Name should be seen first and then the domain.
 2. Steering Configuration tooltip should show Bypass

updated_cases.title: Verify whether clicking on the button next to Inline Policy displayed, which is affected by the categoriy which the URL belongs to, redirects to Edit Page of that policy.
updated_cases.custom_summary: Verify whether clicking on the button next to Inline Policy displayed, which is affected by the categoriy which the URL belongs to, redirects to Edit Page of that policy.
updated_cases.custom_steps:
1. Login to Tenant WebUI
 2. Click on Web, under Profiles in Policies tab
 3. Click on URL Lookup
 4. Under URL Lookup, enter any URL and hit Enter
 5. Click on the Inline Policy Name
updated_cases.custom_expected:
1. In URL List search result, Site Name should be seen first and then the domain.
 2. The Inline Policy names should be displayed.
 3. The page redirects to Edit Page of that policy.

updated_cases.title: Verify whether clicking on the SSL Decryption Policy displayed, which is affected by the categoriy which the URL belongs to, redirects to main page filtered by the policy name
updated_cases.custom_summary: Verify whether clicking on the SSL Decryption Policy displayed, which is affected by the categoriy which the URL belongs to, redirects to main page filtered by the policy name
updated_cases.custom_steps:
1. Login to Tenant WebUI
 2. Click on Web, under Profiles in Policies tab
 3. Click on URL Lookup
 4. Under URL Lookup, enter any URL and hit Enter
 5. Click on the SSL Decryption Policy Name
updated_cases.custom_expected:
1. In URL List search result, Site Name should be seen first and then the domain.
 2. The Inline Policy names should be displayed.
 3. The page redirects to Edit Page of that policy.

updated_cases.title: Verify whether after adding the URL to exception list shows Steering Configuration as bypassed.
updated_cases.custom_summary: Verify whether after adding the URL to exception list shows Steering Configuration as bypassed.
updated_cases.custom_steps:
1. Login to Tenant WebUI
 2. Click on Web, under Profiles in Policies tab
 3. Click on URL Lookup
 4. Under URL Lookup, enter any URL and hit Enter
 5. URL should show as steered
 6. Add the URL to exception list
 7. Perform the steps 2 - 4 again
updated_cases.custom_expected:
1. In URL List search result, Site Name should be seen first and then the domain.
 2. Steering Configuration tooltip should show Bypass

updated_cases.title: Verify whether after removing the URL from exception list shows Steering Configuration as Steer to Netskope.
updated_cases.custom_summary: Verify whether after removing the URL from exception list shows Steering Configuration as Steer to Netskope.
updated_cases.custom_steps:
1. Login to Tenant WebUI
 2. Click on Web, under Profiles in Policies tab
 3. Click on URL Lookup
 4. Under URL Lookup, enter any URL and hit Enter 
 5. URL should show as bypassed
 6. Remove the URL from exception list 
 7. Perform the steps 2 - 4 again
updated_cases.custom_expected:
1. In URL List search result, Site Name should be seen first and then the domain.
 2. Steering Configuration tooltip should not be seen

updated_cases.title: Verify that the disabled ssl decryption policies containing the categories which the URL belongs to are not displayed
updated_cases.custom_summary: Verify the behavior when Altos is disabled.

updated_cases.title: Verify that with the feature disabled, Proxy matches to all the combination of url lists and accordingly to it matches to custom category for the given url
updated_cases.custom_summary:
Verify that with the feature disabled, Proxy matches to all the combination of url lists and accordingly to it matches to custom category for the given url 
Eg: if we have the url list with following entries
 *.domain.com (list 1), *.com (list 2)
then abc.domain.com will match to list 1 as well as list 2
updated_cases.custom_steps:
1.Disable longest prefix match feature
2.Create 2 different url list by adding *.domain.com and *.com
3.Create custom different categories for each of the url list
4.Access abc.domain.com
updated_cases.custom_expected: In this cases list1 and list2 both the url should get matched and accordingly all the custom categories also should aplicable

updated_cases.title: Verify that longest prefix is enabled by default(without any feauture flag defined), Proxy matches the custom category for the given url using longest preffix match logic(existing behavior)
updated_cases.custom_summary:
Verify that with the feature disabled, Proxy matches to all the combination of url lists and accordingly to it matches to custom category for the given url 
Eg: if we have the url list with following entries
 *.domain.com (list 1), *.com (list 2)
then abc.domain.com will match to list 1 as well as list 2
updated_cases.custom_steps:
1.Disable longest prefix match feature
2.Create 2 different url list by adding *.domain.com and *.com
3.Create custom different categories for each of the url list
4.Access abc.domain.com
updated_cases.custom_expected: In this cases list1 should get matched and accordingly all the custom categories also should aplicable

updated_cases.title: Verify that with the feature enabled, Proxy matches the custom category for the given url using longest preffix match logic
updated_cases.custom_summary:
Verify that with the feature enabled, Proxy matches the custom category for the given url using longest preffix match logic
Eg: if we have the url list with following entries
 *.domain.com (list 1), *.com (list 2)
then abc.domain.com will match to list 1 and abc.domain1.com will match to list 2
updated_cases.custom_steps:
1.Disable longest prefix match feature
2.Create 2 different url list by adding *.domain.com and *.com
3.Create custom different categories for each of the url list
4.Access abc.domain.com
updated_cases.custom_expected: In this cases list1 should get matched and accordingly all the custom categories also should aplicable

updated_cases.title: With the feature disabled, verify that longest preffix match for the wild card domains/url in the url list
updated_cases.custom_summary: With the feature disabled, verify that longest preffix match for the wild card domains/url in the url list
updated_cases.custom_steps:
1.Disable longest prefix match feature
2.Create 2 different url list by adding *.domain.com and *.com
3.Create custom different categories for each of the url list
4.Access abc.domain.com
updated_cases.custom_expected:
It should match to all the possible url lists which is applicable and not the best match
Eg:*.com,*.1.com,1.com are present in 3 different url list and with the feature disabled  when we access www.1.com then we should match to all url lists
